data.body:
I encountered a serious bug, but it rarely happens. On Android, while the program is running normally, if this error occurs, the screen will become as follows, then about 5 seconds, then the program crashes
![1779942_10203051717354058_699092375_n](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5468513/2242183/449f61ee-9cf9-11e3-99b8-fd249e6008eb.jpg)

data.title: Skipping an entry during iteration after using ObjectMap.Entries.remove()
Activating window causes maximized windows to restore previous size
data.body:
I don't know what to call it on Windows, but screens can be partially maximized, for example using Windows + Left will fit a window to the left half of the screen.

When a window is in this pseudo-maximized state, deactivating and reactivating the window will cause libgdx to drop the window out of its pseudo-maximized state to its previous size.

To reproduce:
1. Open a libgdx desktop application on windows.
2. Pseudo-maximize the window.  (There are a couple ways to do this)  Use Windows key + Right arrow, or double click the vertical resize grabber
3. Tab out of the window, then tab back in.

Upon reactivation the window will drop out of its maximized state, Display.getWidth() and Display.getHeight() will return the restored window size intead of the correct size.

data.title: Bug where key events were being tracked, but not deduped
data.body:
Fixing an issue that manifests itself on GWT builds. Input events, specifically key up and key down events, are being tracked, but that tracking information is not used to filter duplicate key events.

This can cause unexpected behavior as the desktop backend does not trigger on duplicate events.

data.title: Stuttering
data.body:
Things that makes stuttering unbearable in LibGDX on desktop:

The application not being run in fullscreen.
The OrthographicCamera being larger in fullscreen (ex: 960x540 - fine, 1920x1080 - terrible).
Certain resolutions (ex: 1366x768).

This happens when run on a Windows 7 PC with a native resolution of 1920x1080, I changed the resolution to see how my application would run in other resolutions.

data.title: OrthographicCamera - setToOrtho method issue on android.
Added a Info.plist.xml, robovm.properties and robovm.xml file.
Contact missing fixtureB,  Box2d related
data.body:
Pardon my English,  it's not my native language.I find this bug in libgdx.

In Box2d destroy a fixture(or body) while it was overlaping with another fixture, will invoke the endContact method, and the contact's getFixtureB() method will return null. 

I taked a look in the Contact class,   getFixtureB()  is doing this  "  world.fixtures.get(jniGetFixtureB(addr)) " , since at this moment fixtureB is already removed from the world, the result is null.

I already did some workaround to get over this, but I guess it's nice to fix it in libgdx, right?

data.body: There seems to be performance issues with ipad 1. Can it be improved

data.title: Get rid of reflection in Android backend
data.body: Since Libgdx minimal Android version is 2.2, we can get rid of old reflection techniques and some unnecessary checks. No more reflection in Android backend except `AndroidLiveWallpaper.java` (comments in this class are misleading in some way, so I decided to leave it alone). Also, `AndroidSingleTouchListener.java` is unused anymore but I didn't dare to remove it.

data.title: prevent artifacts on circles and ellipses
data.body: change floor pi to ceil pi

Clicked event fires when it shouldn't
data.body:
Here is a situation:

I press mouse key down, move it away, then release it, ClickListener.clicked doesn't fires, everything OK.

Then I add draggable Actor and again

press mouse key down on actor, move it away(with actor at this time), then release, and this time ClickListener.clicked fires on the stage.

data.title: [Intersector] intersectRayPlane & intersectLinePlane Bug
data.body:
The calculation of t in both methods is incorrect, as shown below.

It is:

``` java
float t = -(origin.dot(plane.getNormal()) + plane.getD()) / denom;
```

and should be:

``` java
float t = (-origin.dot(plane.getNormal()) + plane.getD()) / denom;
```

You can see that the current implementation is incorrect using the following code:

``` java
Vector3 intersection = new Vector3();
Ray ray = new Ray(new Vector3(10, 0, 10), new Vector3(-1, -1, -1));
Intersector.intersectRayPlane(ray, new Plane(new Vector3(0, 1, 0), 5), intersection);
```

intersection will be (5.0,-5.0,5.0) which is obviously not a point on the given plane.

The implementation also limits t to values >= 0 which I think is mathematically not correct.

data.title: allowSameAnimation is not used in setAnimation
data.body:
A recent changes in Animation controller (Small changes in AnimationController #1356) introduced allowSameAnimation parameter. It is now used in animate method to allow restarting the same animation.

However setAnimation method ignores this parameter. PRobably it should also be included there with the same logic.

data.title: Sound not playing when audio file is too short
data.body:
Using this code:
`
clickSound = Gdx.audio.newSound(Gdx.files.internal("data/button-click.ogg"));
clickSound.play();
`
and this .ogg file
http://www.filedropper.com/button-click

libGDX does not seem to play the sound. If I modify the .ogg file to be at least 300ms, then the sound plays.
